Reviews.Title: “A Great Safety Net.”
Reviews.Author: carmelshrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for an extended period due to an a bereavement.We did not know the area or what hotels where available We found it originally on a late booking site but then extended our stay directly with the hotel. The staff where warm courteous and helpful throughout our stay they ensured that we had everyhing we needed and where able to give us helpful advice about local amenities. The breakfasts where suitable for both Vegetarian and meat eaters, you where asked each morning what your prefence would be and it was prepared quickly. Our room itself was tidy and warm which was essential as it was cold on many of the days we stayed.It was a bit noisy on the first night or so but it did settle down. I think you could have asked the staff for anything and i think they would have tried to help. we enjoyed the stay despite the circumstances of us being in london.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Jodie C
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from this B&B, all we needed was a clean bed to collapse in at the end of the day. Luckily the sheets were clean and crisp. The quilt on top of the bed wasn't the best and had cigarette burn holes in it. The bathroom was usable although not the cleanest and had a broken toilet seat. We had to tune the television in ourselves and the reception was awful. There were also dodgy electrics. The walls downstairs were wafer thin, luckily for us our neighbours were quite quiet. Service at the reception was odd to say the least, and we often felt like we were not welcome. The room was advertised as having a hair-dryer though it did not and honestly it was more trouble than worth to complain to reception. We didn't bother with breakfast so I cannot comment on that. One thing that was worrying about our room was the bars on the outside of the window, had there been a fire in the main building we wouldn't of been able to escape. Proximity to Tufnell Park tube station is about a 10 minute walk which is really good for the price of the room, and there are some local kebab and corner shops which is nice. We weren't there to spend much time in the hotel so we were grateful just to have a clean bed and a warm room to sleep in, while I probably wouldn't stay here again, if you're after somewhere cheap and don't mind roughing it a bit then this place is one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “This place was bad in 1985 nothing has changed I see”
Reviews.Author: aussie85_9
Reviews.Content: This place was bad in 1985 - The outside look ok - Friends living closeby booked us in for a week. Three people travelling together - mother and two adult sons. The room had a double and single bed. The bed linen was dirty and stained the ceiling paper was hanging off, the curtains needed replacing. We booked mother into a local B & B and brother and I stayed two nights before we could get into the B & B which was cleaner etc. Being clean isn't that difficult so why is this place so DIRTY. Cheap doesn't mean Dirty is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “I really don't know what people are expecting”
Reviews.Author: maccaderby242
Reviews.Content: What Â£35 hotel have you guys who are complaining stayed in before that has raised your expectations so high to expect more than what you get at this place? Can I have its details please?! I stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011 because I couldnt get my usual place and found this on expedia. I literally checked in at 2pm, put my bag in and left for the day not returning until after midnight. I had a good nights sleep in a comfortable bed (with no bugs), used a clean and well running toilet and shower the next day (with fresh towel and soap supplied) and headed out again. Unfortunately woke too late for breakfast so can't comment on that. I was out the next day and came back to a made bed and tidied room and had another good nights sleep with another clean shower in the morning. Really what more do you want or expect? Its perfectly satisfactory. Yes the rooms are small but remember what you are paying. I stayed in room 22 and it was fine for my needs. The hotel is about a 7 minute walk from Tufnell Park tube which is 10-15 mins tube ride into Leicester Square. If you come back late then I can heartily recommend Turfnell Park kebabs opposite the tube station for the walk home.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting/Keep away”
Reviews.Author: NBzouk2010
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It was a group of us in about 8 different rooms for an activity weekend nearby, so about 12 of us at least, and nobody had a good thing to say. But I seem to have had the worst party. We all had problems with the really poor breakfast offered, the noise at night about which the night receptionist did nothing (over 1 hour on the 2nd night) and the lack of cleanningness. But the worst was the harassment the night receptionist subjected us girls arriving late at night on our own (that night my partner was still on his way, so I arrived alone), that made 2 of my female friends really scared, and the disgusting bedbugs that bite me on the 2nd night. I am still trying to get comments and a full refund from them and I will not stop until this has been resolved!!!!!! The safety deposit box and hairdryer that were supposed to be in every room were nowhere to be seen either. A very unhappy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Susamedusa
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this might not be just the hotels fault. We'd been doblebooked at a better hotel and ended up at Queens Hotel by chance. The receptionist was a very pleasant guy with loads of information, but we only understood half of it due to his indian accent;) But it was the room and the food that came up as the most negative thing in this experience.. Tiny room, tiny bed, only one sheet and a pelt that looked like it had never been washed.. The firealarm started ringing in the middle of the night and we hardly had any sleep at all! The food was .. Yuck.. And the staff didn't understand what we we're ordering so we got the wrong food. The languagebarrier was a bit tuff since noone in the hotel was English.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right! hotel is a disgrace to the industry”
Reviews.Author: shaunsmitht
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel without reading the reviews - BIG mistake.. The hotel is outdated and needs an emergency makeover internally and a social skills course for the staff. On arriving at the hotel we were given a room which to find seemed like an episode of the cryptum factor! The room was in the basement with a shower that a homeless person would think twice about using and general decor that was depressing. We had to tune the TV in and there was a fire exit door outside our room that wasn't locked and could be opened from the inside and outside. When we challenged the reception staff they told me that i was lying and there was no way that the door could be opened from the outside, trust me a trained monkey could open that door and on that point would make a better fist of the role on reception than the sarcastic and surly middle aged Asian gentleman i spoke to who in my opinion is a disgrace and should be fired. I was not alone in complaining, in fact in the 10 minutes i waited at reception there were 4 other guest that came up and complained about a wide range of issues and some refused to stay and left. In hindsight we should of done the same. The beds were dirty and i think staying at a youth hostel would of been a better choice! There was loud music played until 2am so not much sleep was had. What i would say is that even though i have stayed in 5 star hotels before, i did not expect this to be a 5 star, in fact i had prepared myself for a 3 star hotel. In my opinion this hotel if inspected would struggle to achieve above one star. I'm not the type of person to review anything i buy but i feel so strongly about this hotel i had to write my feelings down, hopefully to persuade people like me who though 'well it's cheap, i can put up with anything for one night!' not to stay here. The guests are mainly tourists and that is the worst thing, this hotel is unfortunately an ambassador for the UK and i'm ashamed that people visiting the UK stay here, what impression is that giving to them of us in the UK. To the management of the hotel and the general manager who i was told to see the next morning and the only person who could deal with the complaints. All i can say to you is you must be very busy dealing with complaints and either you, your line manager or the owners of this establishment need to wake up and see that the 'hotel' you 'run' is a disgrace and i would be shocked if this is not closed down when inspected next. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “In need of earplugs...”
Reviews.Author: JaneHaarlem
Reviews.Content: What can you expect for 75 pounds per night? Well, let's be honest, not that much. So, I was comfortable with the idea of having a good night's rest, because that's the main reason for booking a hotel. Well.. that turned out the be quite different. We slept in the basement and had the pleasure of hearing everyone going in and out of the hotel. The night receptionist talked so loudly we could almost hear what he was saying. It was as if he was standing next to us. It kept noisy all night long. Then when we finally could sleep, breakfast started at 7 am. The breakfast room was opposite of our room, so again the noise started. I decided to buy earplugs and slept through the next two nights without waking. But, never ever again, will we go to a hotel like that. Pay a little more to have some extra comfort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: Weasel1977
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the reviews on here, I'm guessing that they were posted before the refurb. Ok it isn't 5 star luxury but it was perfectly adequate and right on the northern tube line

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalieesp
Reviews.Content: I think the worst part of this hotel was the bedding. I donÂ´t think theyÂ´ve ever, ever washed the quilts. They were soooo dusty that I almost die of allergy. It was so disgusting! The water heater provided in the room was totally YELLOW inside and the tea bags were like 3 months old or something, but they seemed very very old, and dusty of course. This hotel has a serious sanitary problem, should be inspected.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Kook5
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with the negative evaluations of previous guests. This place is dire. Just because you offer cheap accommodation does not mean that it should be dirty and unfriendly. The rooms were extremely shabby, only the cheapest of materials! Breakfast was awful, served by very harried looking women one of whom kept shouting into the kitchen when she was tressed out. THis we had the pleasure of hearing as of 6 am as our room was right opposite the breakfast room. Said room was devoid of all adornment. When I asked for eggs and tomatoes I was told, "tomatoes, no". I also found it rather cheeky and suspect that we HAD to pay on arrival and HAD to hand up our keys when leaving for the afternoon. This place can only be described as a dump.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID/DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: katiekins2010
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely awful. Had I not had my daughter with me I would have left and slept in the Park. The tiny room (and you could barley move around the bed) was beyond filthy, floor covered in dirt, and what looked like poo. There was dust everywhere. The smell of stale smoke was so bad it made me feel sick and the toilet and shower actually nearly finished me off. ( I held it in all night!) The rooms and bathrooms clearly are not just cleaned badly but not cleaned at all. Didn't try the breakfast, there is no way I would eat anything from there. They don't give you a key for the front door and when I went to check in there were about 6 people waiting outside for a good ten mins ringing the door to get let in. Plus the reception staff are positively odd. Please do not stay here. I have never written a review about anything, but on this occasion, it was that bad, I feel obliged.

Reviews.Title: “Rather pay some more and stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: 2big
Reviews.Content: The only thing positive about this hotel is it's location. It's in a nice, calm neighbourhood with good tube connection, Tufnell Park station is just 5 min away. The rest is horrible though: Tiny, dirty rooms, plaster dropping of the ceiling, a floor you don't want to touch, not even with your shoes. The worst things are the shower and the toilets, which were never cleaned during my whole stay (3 days), and looked like they hadn't been cleaned the last 3 months either. So rather spend some more money on a better hotel, don't let this one ruin your holiday...

Reviews.Title: “mouse”
Reviews.Author: lester1985
Reviews.Content: went we got there i looked at the place and said OMG this is the worst place we have ever been. the room had paper hanging off on the walls and the ceiling and the worst was yet to come cause at night we had a MOUSE in the room .....

Reviews.Title: “they stole our deposit money!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: spikeMaidstone
Reviews.Content: having read bad reviews of this dump we phoned and cancelled our booking as thery take credit card number before u book......hasving phoned and cancelled well within the month we thought no more of it but they took their sixty five pound anyway....surprise surprise when we phoned they said they would reimburse money....surprise surprise they never and the manager is never ther at time of phoning.....DONT EVER STAY HERE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “dreadfully discusting”
Reviews.Author: jinnyCardiff
Reviews.Content: Miserable male receptionist. Decor drab, old, worn out. Room made you feel dirty the minute you opened the door. Lights not working in toilet or above bed. One thin sheet on filthy old mattress. Luckily stayed out till 3am and got up at 9am for the so called breakfast. Discusting coffee, tiny english breakfast of eggs, teaspoon of beans and some sort of tubular piece of gristle. Felt so embarrased for foreign travellers who i hope dont think we british live in such squallor usually.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody terrible!- Rather sleep in the streets!”
Reviews.Author: PetenRose
Reviews.Content: Dont judge a book by its cover but in this case do! - Photos of actual 'hotel' (B&B) are grossly misleading. for a start, they look clean in the photos. I found dust on the window ledges and mold in the shower. There were scuff marks (I hope they were scuff marks!) on the walls. As you walk up to the B&B you see the gate hanging by a thread trying to prevent unwitting guests from crossing the threshold into the devil's bowels. Paint is flaking off everywhere, building material in the halls. When we arrived we weren't shown to our room, merely given a general direction in which to walk. It was never explained fully about entering and exiting the building (how to contact reception) and not told about fire exits. Our room itslef had mold, dirt, was not vacuumed, holes in the walls, light fixtures without covers, the air vent in the loo was hanging off and filled with dust. The bed was dirty and light above bed hanging off. View was of side/back which was full of rubbish. Said there was tea/coffee facilities. There was tea/sugar but NO milk, NO kettle and cups were dirty again. Windows were filthy with no lock on one (could be lifted open from outside) with towel plugging gap at top. 'Full English Breakfast' = two poached eggs, one sausage and a spoonful of beans one bit of toast. Staff could hardly speak English and when arrived there was an ashtray in room and stunk of fags, which means they must allow smoking in non-smoking rooms (against law). Ran out of toilet roll (in our tiny en-suite). Asked at reception, was told to go to cleaner's cupboard myself to get more. The WORST place ever, would rather sleep on the streets, seriously, would not wish this place upon my worst enemies, do not visit.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pauton
Reviews.Content: This so called hotel can only be described as a hovel .The photographs that accompany the lies about so called services are very misleading as their are no services at all . They describe rooms as having en/suite bathrooms but the only running water came from a leak in the ceiling of my son and his girlfriends room. the bed sheets were unfit for use in a dog basket .As i have a dog i know what i am talking about. my room was also the same. The so called breakfast consisted of sour milk and stale cornflakes that as no suprise was given a miss. I have no reason other than hopeing no body else makes the same mistake as i did in booking the hotel from hell. please please read and remember save your self from major dissopointment .

Reviews.Title: “i wouldnt put a dog in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamKelly01
Reviews.Content: any one thinking of staying here then dont !! after arriving at this dump with my good lady and 3 children around 21.30 for a 1 night stay we found the room was damp. smelly like cat pee ,stains on the walls&ceiling no hot water for a shower not even a plug in the sink when i went to the desk and asked for a plug the guy didnt have one and said sorry and said the water would be hot in the morning, then 10 mins later he turned up with a plug for the sink which he had ripped out of another room ! carpets,curtains very tatty the sheets were grubby and bed covers had fag burns in them and the beds were very uncomfortable, none of us got a decent nights sleep. In the morning the breakfast was poor the sausage was awful tasting and the egg & beans & bacon were cold and the tea was like p**s water the only 2 good points were the close proximity to tufnell park tube station and that we could drop our bags off at the hotel early on arrival in london and collect them late on the day of departure

Reviews.Title: “The hotel from hell, Satans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeraRoed
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Queens hotel in Tufnell Park because of the price and location, and on the pictures online the hotel actually looked quite nice. We ended up booking it for four nigths...sadly. The outside of the hotel made us think of old horror movies, and it did not get any better when we got inside. The smell was hidious, the walls looked moulded and dirty and the reseption was just a hole in the wall. Already then we wanted to leave and never return. We were taken to our room and sadly we discovered that it was no better then what we had already seen. The room was dirty, the bathroom was tiny and disgusting and the closets was filled with mould. My daugther has astma so we could not possibly stay there because of her health. The woman in the reseption was grumpy and she did not really take us seriously. She seemed quite mad, and said that it was one of the nicest room in the hotel and that there had been no complaints before. She claimed she had no other rooms available, but we did not see or hear any other guest there. However, after a while she did find us another room. This was a three bed family room with a horrid smell of cigarettes. This was no better than the first room; it was dirty, the walls and roof were stained and moulded, there was a hole in the floor, the furnitures were broken, and we were unable to shut the window. There were only sheets and blankets (they were so dirty and stained that we did not use them) on the beds, so we almost froze to death. But we somehow made it trougth the nigth, and checked out early in the morning. We did not bother check out the breakfast before we left. We ended up paying 240 pounds for three nigths in another hotel in Bayswater, but it was worth it. The only good thing about Queens hotel in Tufnell park is that I got the money back for the three nigths that we did not stay there. So, if you're looking for a great location to shoot a horror movie, this is definitely the perfect place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews, we didn't”
Reviews.Author: poppie06
Reviews.Content: This hotel leaves a lot to be desired. There is a reason this place is so cheap! The rooms are nothing like what are advertised. Normally when you stay in a hote, you have complimentry shower gel/shampoo that kind of thing but not here - there was nothing. The toilet was situated so close to a wall, you had to sit at an angle. What I will say is the bed was comfortable and the TV was alright but thats about it. Breakfast was shocking - you had tea and coffee from urns, two toast machines which on the first morning, only one was working. They only offered white bread, coco pops (or something simular) and cornflakes - nothing really continental about it. I would seriously suggest re booking if you have the chance, I would definitely do so if I could!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly Worst Hotel Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMusicTraveler
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, this was a last minute reservation made through Hotels.Com website. When we arrived, it was immediately obvious that there was a problem. The room we had supposedly reserved, was not available. The lady at the desk, somewhat apologetic, informed us that instead of an ensuite room, we were getting stuck with what could only be described as the "Dungeon Room." It took forever to sort things out, as she was on the phone with the Hotels.Com(Expedia) site trying to sort the situation out. Even after a lengthy delay, it did not seem anything was accomplished from her call. I told her that I had seen that room as an option, and I intentionally avoided it, because I refused to stay in a room without a bathroom. We were exhausted from a long red eye flight from New York, some time at the airport searching online for a room, and then a long subway ride into the city, complete with all our luggage. We had few options, and were forced to settle for what they had available. I did not feel like traipsing around London, so we took the room. I was told that my rate would be credited, since the non-ensuite room was $30-$40 US cheaper than what I had reserved and paid for. As of now, Hotels.Com has not issued a credit, and I plan to dispute that difference, if not the entire rate paid with my credit card company. The bed in the Dungeon room, was from the dark ages, and the springs pushing through the "mattress," gave your back an invigorating massage, whether you wanted one or not. The "tv," was a nice 9" model, and may not have even had a remote. As already stated, there was no bathroom in the room. You had to walk down the hall, and in the morning, past the breakfast room, to find the shower & toilet. I think we might have been the only unfortunate souls to use the bathroom. What made the Dungeon room so unique though, was the constant feeling that you might somehow die at any moment, if the ceiling caved in. Everytime someone walked up above you, the entire ceiling creaked Loudly. The room above was the reception area, so there was continued walking into the night, but thankfully eventually stopped in the later hours, before starting up again the next morning. This was the beginning of our trip, and we thought it might be over before it started, should the ceiling collapse upon us. Regardless, it was impossible to get any rest, with the constant creaking. My fiance checked out the breakfast, which I think was supposed to have some cooked to order stuff, and she said it didn't look like anything special, with not much really cooked to order. Can't really comment though, since I didn't check it out myself. So other than the screwup with the room reservation, the box springs from H*LL and a ceiling in desperate need of attention, our stay at Queens Hotel, at 33 Anson, London, was fantastic. There is a reason why the last 14 English ratings at Trip Advisor breakdown as 8 One's, 4 Two's, and 2 Three's. Save Yourself While You Can!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - helped me get a foothold in London”
Reviews.Author: layzuk
Reviews.Content: These days I'd never stay in a hotel like this because I'm used to the comfort of 4 star and above hotels, however when I first moved to London I booked a month in advance (Mon-Thurs - heading back home every Friday) at just Â£25 a night. In the end I think I stayed four months at the place, the low price meant I was saving money compared to getting my own place in London so I waited to make sure I was totally settled in to my new job before committing to renting my own apartment. The price tag should give the game away, don't expect too much, although I was told that I had been given one of their better rooms as I'd booked a block of weeks. I had no problems with the bed at the time, but these days I'm used to more comfortable beds and can imagine not being as happy. Back then I could sleep happily on a mates floor without issues. There were some odd retro touches in the hotel such as a very old poster of a tube map on the wall that had the Jubilee Line listed as under construction and known by it's original name, the Fleet Line and no Heathrow Terminal 4 on the map. I hope it was put there for historical value rather than to help their customers find their way around London. Location was fine, Tufnell Park station is on the Northern Line and it's also on the route of the 390 bus that runs by Kings Cross. My job was in Moorgate so getting to work was easy from here. Breakfast - I usually preferred to get something close to work so I could maximise sleep (I started at 8am), therefore I never tried the hotel breakfast. Rooms - they had both en-suite (i.e. either a bath or shower in the room) and regular (shared bathroom). My room had a shower. There's still a lot of small independent hotels in the UK like this. I had no problems with the staff, the ones I encountered were talkative and friendly. I'm a bit worried about some of these more recent reviews though, has maintenance been slipping? With prices as low as they charge I can imagine that there's not much budget for renovation. So would I recommend it? Well if you're starting a job in London and don't have much of a budget the hotel is worth checking out. When I expressed interest in booking this hotel as a temporary place to stay when I started my first London job they showed me the room they'd allocate me before I made any commitment. I think this is worth doing to ensure that you're happy staying there. If you're just visiting London for a couple of days holiday I'd say it's worth paying a bit extra for one of the cheaper chain hotels if you're on a budget (e.g Premier Inn) and if you're not on a budget then London has some really nice luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “appalling - should be closed”
Reviews.Author: Deflumine
Reviews.Content: Part of a group, I saw such things as hairs in the bed, rather strange stains on the sheets and covers, holes in the walls, overall disgusting Luckily I brought handtowel from home to put on filthy and greasy pillow Some rooms in basement are even worse Breakfast is a further disgrace - hotels like this should be closed in a country like UK

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickymonsoon
Reviews.Content: This Hotel needs closing down. Or at least a visit from Health and Safety...It is a fire risk... The place is FILTHY and smelly, grime, dust ,dirt,snot !!! Broken mirrors, broken chairs..Very rude kitchen staff, no manner , abrupt rude, insensitive...Water is running down the walls from the ceiling of the dining room onto a lightswitch...This was pointed out to the Staff...who said WE KNOW ABOUT IT ,BUT NOTHING IS EVER DONE ABOUT IT..???!! We spent one night at the place in April....after being woken at 3 in the morning by loud banging and shouting noises...WE WERE VERY GLAD TO LEAVE.....AVOID !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst night in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: OccationalHotelUser
Reviews.Content: Worst night ever. The rooms we were able to open even when they were shut and locked, this we realised on returning from a night out to find our rooms had been robbed. Staff were unwilling to help or compensate and offered no appologies for our loss. The decor and cleanlyness was undesirable and the shower was terrible. would not recommend to any friend or enemy.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in !”
Reviews.Author: Rodmat
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe how hotels like this stay in business. If hotels could be struck off, then this one should have been years ago. It is in desperate need of complete redecoration or, more likely, demolition. The room was appalling, paint peeling, cracks in walls and ceiling, bathroom taps covered in limescale, bathroom window cracked and unlockable, curtains visably dirty. I cannot comment on breakfast as this is not served til 8.00 and I had to leave at that time.

HotelInfo.Name: Queens Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 33 Anson Rd. | Tufnell Park, London N7 0RB, England
